alert.note: Alert for Greenville (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued January 04 at 7:30AM EST until January 04 at 11:00AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... East Central Greenville County in upstate South Carolina... * Until 1100 AM EST. * At 730 AM EST, After a period of heavy rain and embedded thunderstorms this morning, totals nearing 3 inches in spots, excessive runoff will gradually worsen flooding of low-lying areas across greater Greenville, which includes the Reedy and Enoree Basins. Parts of Unity and Cleveland Parks will flood and high water conditions are expected in many parts of Greenville. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Greenville Downtown, Greenville Eastside, West Greenville, Greer, Mauldin, Taylors, Berea, Welcome, Travelers Rest, Cherrydale Point, Donaldson Center, Paris Mountain State Park and Furman University. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
